title: Ranked - Bronze 4 - Attitude

embed.description: Every game is a story; visit the new League of Legends match history to check out how this one ends and share your own!

body:
Contrary to popular belief, it is possible to win a game from behind.

Even when you are on the ropes, with fists being thrown from both sides.

This link is proof that with the right attitude, and good defensive tactics, you can win. During this match, the LeBlanc repeatedly informed us that 'The game is over, Just ff'. Blaming the rengar for feeding (Lots of deaths, but I would say he was having a bad game.)

We  were down to our nexus.. it looked like it was over, but we pushed on.. defended until our inhibitors returned, won an ace, and obtained baron. Which then led to more pushing, and another ace, where we finally pushed to their nexus and won. Teamwork and dedication to win..

Lots of people need to start realizing that attitude, commitment and tactics are more valuable in the late game, than kills and how far back you are pushed.

replies.body:
I was in this exact same situation. They got baron and we were down to just our nexus, with my Bard and Brand literally fighting off a Cait and horde of siege minions. I even had to ult it was so bad. We ended up getting a couple of aces or near-aces and won the game. Look at the match report - our team was still behind in gold when we won, that's how bad it was. Never give up, never surrender.

http://matchhistory.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/OC1/131764702/201230640?tab=overview

That's such an amazing feat of strength. Winning the game, yet you were behind and STILL statistically behind at the very end.

It almost seems impossible that such a thing could exist, but you did it.

Well done, loved reading the stats on that match. 

It's hard to find people with the same mindset, so if you'd like to hit up a few games some time, add me in game!
Yep, add me (I'll inevitibly forget). TheSpawnMan.
